data.name: 8-ball setup validation
data.description:
Two guys decided to play [Eightball](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eight-ball).
To play this game they need fifteen balls. Balls with numbers from 1 to 7 are called "solid-colored" and balls with numbers from 8 to 15 are "striped balls".

To start the game fifteen balls should be placed on the pool table and form a triangle.
Guys decided to apply the following rules that describes valid balls setup in the triangle:

* Ball with number eight must be placed in the center of the rack (i.e., the middle of the third row).

* Balls in left and right bottom corners should be different colored.

* Balls in one line parallel to one of triangle's sides should not have the same color.

The corners of the triangle does not need to be validated in terms of rule number three.
Lines with number of balls greather than one should be.

Your task is to write function ```eightBallValid``` that checks if the specified setup is valid. For example the following input is a valid setup:
```
[[1], [3,11], [14,8,6], [2,4,15,13], [12,10,9,5,7]]
```
![b31b527cb38486f0df4475791a1ba393.png](https://pichoster.net/images/2017/04/22/b31b527cb38486f0df4475791a1ba393.png)

The following input is not valid:
```
[[1], [3,4], [14,8,6], [2,11,15,13], [12,10,9,5,7]]
```
![968fc9038d1a847fd25f6620b12483a7.png](https://pichoster.net/images/2017/04/22/968fc9038d1a847fd25f6620b12483a7.png)

This input is also invalid:
```
[[1], [3,11], [14,8,6], [2,9,5,13], [12,10,4,15,7]]
```
[![f64c8d705d05eb3c58c1f2412af3fdce.png](https://pichoster.net/images/2017/04/22/f64c8d705d05eb3c58c1f2412af3fdce.png)](https://pichoster.net/image/KF1h3)
